reviews.text:
What a gem!!! The service was excellent, like a well oiled machine. Everyone working had a great knowledge about the food and drinks and went to great lengths to make all visitors feel welcome.
The food is on another level, hard to comment. As the kitchen is open you can see the compassion and care that is put in every dish. Can’t fault any of the dishes we had but have to highlight the mutton chops. Melt in the mouth comfort food. Guys you’ve knocked it out of the ballpark!!!

All of the food is amazing. The chefs are brilliant with their use of flavors & textures. You can order family style and share the appetizers and entrees, but save room for your own dessert. Be adventurous or play it safe, there is something for all palates. The staff was outstanding and extremely friendly and accommodating. I love this place and would recommend it to everyone.

Had to try the Climpson’s Arch location after going to the original Brat, one of our  favourite restaurants in London. Great ambiance, located in one of the archway viaducts, with outdoor and indoor seating. The menu changes daily, and you’re asked to take a picture at the door before you’re seated. We sat at the bar in the back of the restaurant which was lovely. Ordered the side bread & butter, roasted leeks, steak tartar, and chicken rice. Everything was delicious, but we probably wouldn’t order the steak tartar again.  The cocktails were light and paired well with the food, we each got the old friend and arch negroni. Overall, I would definitely come back to this location.

This isnt really a 'small plates' restaurant but it really isn't an 'individual' plates restaurant either. It felt like a communal plates type place, which is perfect.
We ordered various foods and it was all well made and well presented, easy to share amongst friends and family. The cocktails were well mixed with good amounts of alcohol. Plenty of wine to be had as well

The outdoor seating feels great, sadly, it was too cold to truly enjoy it when during my visit and the patio felt a bit closed off, which resulted in a more smokey atmosphere due to the proximity of the kitchen to the patio. It wasn't overbearing or unmanageable, in fact the smells were delicious. However, fresh air would have been preferred.

I look forward to coming back during the warmer months.

This restaurant is so so good! I love the original location in Shoreditch, but this location has a more laid-back vibe that makes it versatile and ideal for many occasions. The food is masterfully created and the drink selection is exceptional. The espresso martini on tap is also a nice touch. Can’t wait to go back and highly recommend!
